definition: Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]
Taiwan pr. used in 夾生|夹生[jia1 sheng1] and 夾竹桃|夹竹桃[jia1 zhu2 tao2]
to press from either side/to place in between/to sandwich/to carry sth under armpit/wedged between/between/to intersperse/to mix/to mingle/clip/folder/Taiwan pr. [jia2]

sentences.english: She rambled on at great length but she didn't get to the heart of the matter.
sentences.chinese: 她夹七夹八地说了许多话也没说到点子上。

definition: to muddle things together (idiom)/to bother sb with annoying muddle-headed talk
to mumble in whispers/to mutter to oneself
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
to persuade using all possible arguments (idiom); to act good cop and bad cop in turn
lit. to point at the chicken while scolding the dog (idiom)/fig. to make indirect criticisms
verbose or unclear in speech/rambling and indistinct
to invent crazy nonsense/to cook up (excuses)/to talk at random/wild babble
